snippet: Charles J. Hynes, the former Brooklyn district attorney, started out with populist promise, defending the poorest and establishing humane prison programs. But his political sensitivities gradually enslaved him.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column looks back on career of former Brooklyn district attorney Charles J Hynes, who is accused of misusing public funds; says that in 1980s, Hynes showed populist promise, defending city's poor and downtrodden, but political sensitivities and eye on voting eventually got the better of him and clouded his judgement.
lead_paragraph: Charles J. Hynes, the former Brooklyn district attorney, started out with populist promise, defending the poorest and establishing humane prison programs. But his political sensitivities gradually enslaved him.

headline.main: A Proud Career That Seemed to Curdle
headline.print_headline: A Proud Career That Seemed to Curdle
